eg

Class Formatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.Formatter

  • public class Formatter
extends java.lang.Object
    The formatting of EditArea objects. The properties 'Wordwrap', 'Font' and 'FontSize' are initially read from Prefs.
    See Also:
    EditArea

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Formatter(int number, java.lang.String keyPrefix)
      Creates a Formatter for a given number of EditArea objects that are formatted.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createEditAreaAt(int i)
      Assigns a new formatted EditArea to this EditArea array at the specified position
      EditArea editArea()
      Gets this formatted EditArea if the number of EditArea objects is equal to 1
      EditArea[] editAreaArray()
      Gets this EditArea array if the number of EditArea objects is minumum 2
      void enableWordWrap(boolean wordwrap)
      Sets the boolean that specifies if wordwrap is enabled.
      void openSetFontDialog()
      Makes the dialog for setting the font and font size visible
      void setIndex(int i)
      Selects the element in this EditArea array in which the wordwrap state may be changed.
      void setProperties()
      Sets the current values for the properties wordwrap, font and font size in Prefs
      void showLineNumbers(boolean lineNumbers)
      Sets the boolean that specifies if line numbers are shown.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Formatter

        public Formatter(int number,
                 java.lang.String keyPrefix)
        Creates a Formatter for a given number of EditArea objects that are formatted. Only if number is equal to 1 a formatted EditArea is created and is accessed through editArea(). If number is minimum 2 an initially empty array is created.
        Parameters:
        number - the number of EditArea objects
        keyPrefix - A prefix for the keys for the format properties set in Prefs. Can be the empty string

    • Method Detail

      • editArea

        public EditArea editArea()
        Gets this formatted EditArea if the number of EditArea objects is equal to 1
        Returns:
        this EditArea

      • editAreaArray

        public EditArea[] editAreaArray()
        Gets this EditArea array if the number of EditArea objects is minumum 2
        Returns:
        this EditArea array

      • createEditAreaAt

        public void createEditAreaAt(int i)
        Assigns a new formatted EditArea to this EditArea array at the specified position
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the array element

      • setIndex

        public void setIndex(int i)
        Selects the element in this EditArea array in which the wordwrap state may be changed.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the array element

      • openSetFontDialog

        public void openSetFontDialog()
        Makes the dialog for setting the font and font size visible

      • enableWordWrap

        public void enableWordWrap(boolean wordwrap)
        Sets the boolean that specifies if wordwrap is enabled. Enabling wordwrap also hides line numbers whereas disabling wordwrap shows line numbers if the corresponding boolean is set to true in showLineNumbers(boolean).

        The wordwrap state is changed only in the element specified in setIndex(int)

        Parameters:
        wordwrap - the boolean value; true to enable

      • showLineNumbers

        public void showLineNumbers(boolean lineNumbers)
        Sets the boolean that specifies if line numbers are shown.

        Line numbers are not shown in EditArea objects in which wordwrap is enabled.

        Parameters:
        lineNumbers - the boolean value, true to show

      • setProperties

        public void setProperties()
        Sets the current values for the properties wordwrap, font and font size in Prefs
